metadata.title: How to Create an Elegant Website for your Data Science Portfolio in 10 minutes | by Khuyen Tran | Towards Data Science
metadata.h1: How to Create an Elegant Website for your Data Science Portfolio in 10 minutes
metadata.description: If resume is the only source to showcase your experience and projects, you have set yourself behind many other candidates in your job search. Why? Because you need to limit all of your valuable…

all_paragraphs: If resume is the only source to showcase your experience and projects, you have set yourself behind many other candidates in your job search. Why? Because you need to limit all of your valuable experience, courses, skills, communitive activities, certificates, and awards in one piece of paper! As you achieve more, you feel hesitant to fix your resume because it takes a lot of work to fix the format, the word size, etc. Thus, it is important to have a website to show your background and skills.
“Yes, I know a website is important, but when I get to Wordpress or other website builders, I found that there are many steps to set up so I decide not to even try but stick with my resume”
If that is your thought, what if you know that you can create a portfolio like this in 10 minutes?
With a few steps, you will possess a professional website to showcase your potential employers.
First access to the template from Glitch here. Create a free account and click View Source.
Click Remix to Edit in the rightmost corner of the page
Change the name in the top-left corner to the name that you want to website to be. The best way to name your website is your name.
Now you can access your website at somename.glitch.me! All you need to do now is to change the information in _config.yaml section. Rerun the website to see the change.
Your experience with relevant information such as position, company, time period, description, and links.
What have you contributed to your school, work, or the surrounding community? Here is the section that you can showcase your leadership skills

This section shows your skills. Better yet, show them with icons. If there are some other skills that you are looking for not in the icon list, find more icons on Font Awesome. All you need to do is to find the icon that you want and insert the name in the tools section.
If you cannot find the icon you want, you can add in extra_skills section.

Here is where you can showcase the workshops and events relevant to data science that you have attended or gave a talk. Taking note of the workshops you attended can make a huge difference in your resume.

A data science resume cannot lack projects. It is important for recruiters to see what you have done and how you have done it. If your link is too long, you can shorten the URL using bitly. You can also attach the tags and images to add visualization for your projects

A quick fix to attach the image so the images you insert in assets will be shown. Go to templates/index.html, here is the html code where the website is built. Don’t worry! You don’t need to be familiar with html. All you need to do is to change from
A placeholder for the awards you have received. Even small awards are worth mentioning.

You don’t want to have a particular section for your website because of the lack of information but would like to add information to that section as you achieve more? You can easily do that by making the section invisible. Let’s say you don’t want workshops section to be on your website. Go to templates/index.html. Use Ctrl/Command + F to find the keywords quickly. In the search bar, insert “workshops”. You should see the section where the workshop is at.

The first section you want to comment out is the item on the menu. Comment out with <!-- before and — — -> after the section you want to make invisible. Do the same thing with another part of html where workshops appear.
And now you no longer see the Workshops section. Neat!

I hope you are able to see how easy it is to create a professional website for your portfolio. Now when introducing yourself to a potential employer or recruiter, you can confidently share with them your website. If you don’t have many things in your portfolio yet, don’t worry! As you see your accomplishments on the website, you will feel motivated to achieve more. Take note of small accomplishments. Even a small thing matters when added up over time.
I like to write about basic data science concepts and play with different algorithms and data science tools. You could connect with me on LinkedIn and Twitter.
Star this repo if you want to check out the codes for all of the articles I have written. Follow me on Medium to stay informed with my latest data science articles like these:
Your home for data science. A Medium publication sharing concepts, ideas and codes.
